definition: lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
variant of 劍|剑[jian4]
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
crossbow
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes

sentences.english: At the end of Jiang’s second term, Beijingand Taipei wereon a collision course.
sentences.chinese: 在江第二届任期之末，北京与台北剑拔弩张。

sentences.english: Even the Thai-Cambodian troops on both sides are at daggers drawn as people think.
sentences.chinese: 就连泰柬两边的驻军也没有人们想象的那样剑拔弩张。

sentences.english: So are US forces in the region.
sentences.chinese: 美国在该地区的力量也剑拔弩张。

sentences.english: The two agendas sit in tension, but they are not contradictory.
sentences.chinese: 虽说这两个政党剑拔弩张，但是他们并不矛盾。

sentences.english: The North and South were at loggerheads.
sentences.chinese: 南北双方形成了剑拔弩张的紧张局势。

sentences.english: Buyers and sellers is mutual on credit grade issue diversionary , at swords' points.
sentences.chinese: 买卖双方在信用评级问题上互相牵制，剑拔弩张。

definition: to stand opposite/to confront/confrontation
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
could happen at any moment/on the verge
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
smell of gunpowder/(fig.) combative tone/belligerence
to meet on the battlefield (idiom)
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to be awfully (busy etc)
sharply opposed to each other, with neither prepared to give an inch (idiom)
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
neither giving way to the other
both sides (in contract)/the two opposing sides (in a dispute)
overbearing/forceful/aggressive/menacing/imperious
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
war of words
completely incompatible/lit. incompatible as fire and water
